message.content: This question requires knowledge about the hardness scale of minerals. The hardness scale, known as the Mohs scale, ranks minerals from 1 to 10 based on their scratch resistance. Fingernails have a hardness of approximately 2.5, so they can scratch minerals with a hardness less than 2.5. Copper has a hardness of 3 on the Mohs scale, so it is harder than a fingernail. Calcite has a hardness of 3, so it is also harder than a fingernail. Quartz has a hardness of 7, which is much harder than a fingernail. However, graphite has a hardness of 1.5, which is less than a fingernail, making it the correct option.

This question requires knowledge of the Mohs scale of mineral hardness, which ranks minerals from 1 (softest) to 10 (hardest). Fingernails have a hardness of about 2.5, so they are harder than minerals ranked below 2.5 but softer than those ranked above 2.5. Copper has a hardness of about 2.5-3, so it is the same hardness as a fingernail. Graphite has a hardness of 1-2, so it is softer than a fingernail. Calcite has a hardness of 3, so it is harder than a fingernail. Quartz has a hardness of 7, so it is much harder than a fingernail. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) Graphite.
